SectionScriptObjects.Name: Script Objects
SectionScriptObjects.Description:
These objects are passed into StrokesPlus.net automations which can be used in your steps or script as needed.

All regular actions will be passed in an ActionVars object named "action".

Global Actions > Mouse Events > Mouse Wheel are passed in a WheelTick object named "wheel".

Global Actions > Mouse Events > Mouse Click are passed in a Click object named "click".

Floater events will be passed in a FloaterVars object named "floater".

ActionVars.Name: ActionVars

Click.Name: Click

Wheel.Name: WheelTick

Floater.Name: FloaterVars

DisplayTextInfo.Name: DisplayTextInfo

PopupMenuInfo.Name: PopupMenuInfo

PopupMenuInfoEx.Name: PopupMenuInfoEx

PopupMenuItem.Name: PopupMenuItem

InputBoxInfo.Name: InputBoxInfo

SectionExposedObjects.Name: Section.NET and ClearScript
SectionExposedObjects.Description:
These objects are available in all scripts and give you access into the .NET Framework or script engine host functions (ClearScript).
 
clr = mscorlib, System, System.Core
drawing = System.Drawing
forms = System.Windows.Forms
net = System.Net
http = System.Net.Http
host = ExtendedHostFunctions (see ClearScript help)
clip = System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard
sysinfo = System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation
speech = System.Speech

NativeModules - Any types created by the sp.NativeModule methods
NativeDelegates - Any delegate classes created via sp.NativeDelegate or sp.NativeDelegateList

SectionLocateWindow.Name: Locate Windows or Controls
SectionLocateWindow.Description: Functions for finding or retrieving windows.

AllApplications.Name: AllApplications
AllApplications.Description: Returns an array of SystemWindow objects for all primary application windows. This may incorrectly skip or include unconventional applications. See also sp.AllWindows().

AllWindows.Name: AllWindows
AllWindows.Description: Returns an array of SystemWindow objects for all controls and windows. See also sp.AllApplications().

DesktopWindow.Name: DesktopWindow
DesktopWindow.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the Desktop window. This is the actual desktop window, not necessarily the window which contains the desktop icons. See also sp.DesktopWindowListView().

DesktopWindowListView.Name: DesktopWindowListView
DesktopWindowListView.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the Desktop ListView window, which is where the desktop icons reside.

ForegroundWindow.Name: ForegroundWindow
ForegroundWindow.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object of the current foreground window

LastActiveWindow.Name: LastActiveWindow
LastActiveWindow.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the last active primary window.

LastApplication.Name: LastApplication
LastApplication.Description: Activates the last active, non-minimized window, similar to Alt+Tab

LastFocusControl.Name: LastFocusControl
LastFocusControl.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the last active control.

NextApplication.Name: NextApplication
NextApplication.Description: Activates the next window in the stack

WindowFromClassOrTitle.Name: WindowFromClassOrTitle
WindowFromClassOrTitle.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for a control or window based on the class name and/or title.

className.Name: className
className.Description: Exact name of the control or window class.

windowTitle.Name: windowTitle
windowTitle.Description: Exact title of the control or window class.

WindowFromHandle.Name: WindowFromHandle
WindowFromHandle.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object of a window or control from an existing handle

handle.Name: handle
handle.Description: Handle to the control or window

WindowFromPoint.Name: WindowFromPoint
WindowFromPoint.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object of a control or window (based on topLevelOnly parameter) from a point (coordinate) on the screen

pt.Name: pt
pt.Description: Coordinates to use in finding the window, e.g. new Point(100, 100), sp.GetCurrentMousePoint(), action.Start

topLevelOnly.Name: topLevelOnly
topLevelOnly.Description: Pass true to only return the top level window (the main application), false returns the window or control directly below the point.

WindowsFromTitlePartial.Name: WindowsFromTitlePartial
WindowsFromTitlePartial.Description: Returns an array of SystemWindow objects for controls or windows based on a partial title match.

partialTitle.Name: partialTitle
partialTitle.Description: Partial search string. This is an exact partial match not a wildcard or regular expression match.

WindowsFromTitleRegex.Name: WindowsFromTitleRegex
WindowsFromTitleRegex.Description: Returns an array of SystemWindow objects for controls or windows based on a regular expression title match.

SectionLanguage.Name: Language/Culture
SectionLanguage.Description: Functions for getting and changing language culture.

ChangeCulture.Name: ChangeCulture
ChangeCulture.Description: Changes the current language culture to the specified one.

cultureName.Name: cultureName
cultureName.Description: The name of the language culture to make the current culture. Examples: 'en-US', 'pl-PL', 'zh-CN'.

GetCurrentCulture.Name: GetCurrentCulture
GetCurrentCulture.Description: Returns the current culture code, e.g. en-US, pl-PL.

SectionInternal.Name: Internal
SectionInternal.Description: Functions for working with StrokesPlus.net internals.

CloseSettings.Name: CloseSettings
CloseSettings.Description: Closes the Settings window, with or without saving changes.

savePendingChanges.Name: savePendingChanges
savePendingChanges.Description: Indicates where to save (true) or discard (false) any changes.

ConsumePhysicalInput.Name: ConsumePhysicalInput
ConsumePhysicalInput.Description: Consumes ALL physical mouse and keyboard input. NOTE: Be very careful when using this function, if you call it with true and either forget to call it again with false (or the script runs into an error), you may be stuck unable to use the computer!
ConsumePhysicalInput.SimpleExample: sp.ConsumePhysicalInput(true or false); //Be careful to not pass true and fail to call again passing false!

active.Name: active
active.Description: True to consume all input, false to allow input.

DisableCapture.Name: DisableCapture
DisableCapture.Description: Disables the mouse and keyboard hooks.

DisableNext.Name: DisableNext
DisableNext.Description: Disables the next stroke or secondary stroke button press from capturing.

Enable.Name: Enable
Enable.Description: Enables StrokesPlus.net. Note: The only way to execute this would be via timer created by sp.CreateTimer.

EnableCapture.Name: EnableCapture
EnableCapture.Description: Enables the mouse and keyboard hooks.

ExecutePreviousScript.Name: ExecutePreviousScript
ExecutePreviousScript.Description: Executes one of the previous 5 scripts that were executed. The last 5 scripts are stored in history and the index specifies which one to retrieve. The index is zero based, so 0 is the most recent script, 4 is the oldest script in history.

index.Name: index
index.Description: Index of the previous script to execute.

ExecuteStoredScript.Name: ExecuteStoredScript
ExecuteStoredScript.Description: Executes a script previously stored via sp.StoreHistoryScript.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the stored history script.

Exit.Name: Exit
Exit.Description: Stops all timers and scripts, saves settings, and closes StrokesPlus.net.

GetHistoryScript.Name: GetHistoryScript
GetHistoryScript.Description: Returns a history script of the specified index. The last 5 scripts are stored in history and the index specifies which one to retrieve. The index is zero based, so 0 is the most recent script, 4 is the oldest script in history.

index.Name: index
index.Description: Index of the history script to retrieve.

RelayGesture.Name: RelayGesture
RelayGesture.Description: Relays the mouse down, mouse movements, and mouse release based on the points and button specified.

points.Name: points
points.Description: Array of Points used to relay the gesture.

button.Name: button
button.Description: The mouse button to be pressed down at the start of points and released at the end.

Reload.Name: Reload
Reload.Description: Stops all scripts, timers, and reloads StrokesPlus.net.

ReloadScriptEnginePool.Name: ReloadScriptEnginePool
ReloadScriptEnginePool.Description: Stops all scripts and reloads the script engine pool.

ToggleTrayIcon.Name: ToggleTrayIcon
ToggleTrayIcon.Description: Toggles the visibility of the StrokesPlus.net tray icon.

CreateTimer.Name: CreateTimer
CreateTimer.Description: Creates a timer that executes a script repeatedly until stopped via sp.DeleteTimer.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the timer.

startdelay.Name: startdelay
startdelay.Description: Number of milliseconds until the timer starts.

interval.Name: interval
interval.Description: Number of millseconds between each timer script execution.

script.Name: script
script.Description: The script to execute upon starting and at each interval.

DeleteAllTimers.Name: DeleteAllTimers
DeleteAllTimers.Description: Stops and deletes all timers created via sp.CreateTimer.

DeleteTimer.Name: DeleteTimer
DeleteTimer.Description: Stops and deletes a timer previously created via sp.CreateTimer.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the timer.

GetTimer.Name: GetTimer
GetTimer.Description: Returns a timer previously created via sp.CreateTimer.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the timer.

GetTimerScript.Name: GetTimerScript
GetTimerScript.Description: Returns the script from the previouly created timer via sp.CreateTimer.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the timer.

SectionStoreRetrieveData.Name: Store/Retrieve Data
SectionStoreRetrieveData.Description: Functions for storing, retrieving, and deleting stored data.

DeleteStoredBool.Name: DeleteStoredBool
DeleteStoredBool.Description: Deletes a boolean previously stored using sp.StoreBool.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the boolean.

DeleteStoredHandle.Name: DeleteStoredHandle
DeleteStoredHandle.Description: Deletes a handle previously stored using sp.StoreHandle.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the handle.

DeleteStoredHistoryScript.Name: DeleteStoredHistoryScript
DeleteStoredHistoryScript.Description: Deletes a history script previously stored using sp.StoreHistoryScript.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the history script.

DeleteStoredNumber.Name: DeleteStoredNumber
DeleteStoredNumber.Description: Deletes a number previously stored using sp.StoreNumber.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the number.

DeleteStoredObject.Name: DeleteStoredObject
DeleteStoredObject.Description: Deletes an object previously stored using sp.StoreObject.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the object.

DeleteStoredPoint.Name: DeleteStoredPoint
DeleteStoredPoint.Description: Deletes a point previously stored point using sp.StorePoint.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the point.

DeleteStoredRectangle.Name: DeleteStoredRectangle
DeleteStoredRectangle.Description: Deletes a rectangle previously stored using sp.StoreRectangle.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the rectangle.

DeleteStoredString.Name: DeleteStoredString
DeleteStoredString.Description: Deletes a string previously stored string using sp.StoreString.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the string.

GetStoredBool.Name: GetStoredBool
GetStoredBool.Description: Returns a boolean previously stored using sp.StoreBool.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the boolean.

GetStoredHandle.Name: GetStoredHandle
GetStoredHandle.Description: Returns an handle previously stored using sp.StoreHandle.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the handle.

GetStoredHistoryScript.Name: GetStoredHistoryScript
GetStoredHistoryScript.Description: Returns a history script previously stored using sp.StoreHistoryScript

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the history script.

GetStoredNumber.Name: GetStoredNumber
GetStoredNumber.Description: Returns a number previously stored using sp.StoreNumber.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the number.

GetStoredObject.Name: GetStoredObject
GetStoredObject.Description: Returns an object previously stored using sp.StoreNumber.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the object.

GetStoredPoint.Name: GetStoredPoint
GetStoredPoint.Description: Returns a point previously stored using sp.StorePoint.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the point.

GetStoredRectangle.Name: GetStoredRectangle
GetStoredRectangle.Description: Returns a rectangle previously stored using sp.StoreRectangle.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the rectangle.

GetStoredString.Name: GetStoredString
GetStoredString.Description: Returns a string previously stored using sp.StoreString.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the string.

StoreBool.Name: StoreBool
StoreBool.Description: Stores a boolean using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredBool.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the boolean.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the boolean to store.

StoreHandle.Name: StoreHandle
StoreHandle.Description: Stores a handle using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredHandle.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the handle.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the handle to store.

StoreHistoryScript.Name: StoreHistoryScript
StoreHistoryScript.Description: Stores a history script using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredHistoryScript.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the history script.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the history script to store.

StoreNumber.Name: StoreNumber
StoreNumber.Description: Stores a number using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredNumber.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the number.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the number to store.

StoreObject.Name: StoreObject
StoreObject.Description: Stores an object using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredObject.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the object.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the object to store.

StorePoint.Name: StorePoint
StorePoint.Description: Stores a point using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredPoint.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the point.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the point to store.

StoreRectangle.Name: StoreRectangle
StoreRectangle.Description: Stores a rectangle using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredRectangle.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the rectangle.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the rectangle to store.

StoreString.Name: StoreString
StoreString.Description: Stores a string using the specified name. Value can be retrieved via sp.GetStoredString.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name used to store the string.

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the string to store.

SectionInputAndDisplay.Name: Input and Display
SectionInputAndDisplay.Description: Functions for displaying and collecting information from the user.

DisplayImage.Name: DisplayImage
DisplayImage.Description: Displays a popup on the screen containing the image passed in. Click and drag to move the window, press Escape or double-click the window to close.
DisplayImage.SimpleExample: sp.DisplayImage(clip.GetImage(), true); //Assumes an image is on the clipboard, enables mouse wheel scroll zooming

image.Name: image
image.Description: The .NET Image object to be displayed in the popup window.

allowScrollZooming.Name: allowScrollZooming
allowScrollZooming.Description: If true, enables mouse wheel scrolling to zoom image in or out.

DisplayText.Name: DisplayText
DisplayText.Description: Displays a popup on the screen containing a title and text. Fonts, colors, opacity, duration, among other properties can be controlled. See DisplayTextInfo for more details.

info.Name: info
info.Description: The DisplayTextInfo object containing the information used to display the popup.

DisplayTextClose.Name: DisplayTextClose
DisplayTextClose.Description: Closes a popup previously displayed via sp.DisplayText.

DisplayTextUpdate.Name: DisplayTextUpdate
DisplayTextUpdate.Description: Updates the current popup created by sp.DisplayText. This is far more efficient than closing and displaying a new popup.

info.Name: info
info.Description: The DisplayTextInfo object containing the information used to display the popup.

HTMLWindow.Name: HTMLWindow
HTMLWindow.Description: Displays a window which hosts a WebView2 control to display and make interactive HTML windows.

HTML.Name: HTML
HTML.Description: HTML to use for the document, if IncludeBootstrapJQuery is true, HTML will be inserted inside the <body> tag, otherwise it will be the entire document.

ScriptCallback.Name: ScriptCallback
ScriptCallback.Description: Name of the callback to function to invoke when window.chrome.webview.postMessage is called from within the HTML window's JavaScript.

OnDocumentCreatedScript.Name: OnDocumentCreatedScript
OnDocumentCreatedScript.Description: JavaScript to execute in the HTML window once the document is created.

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: Identifier for the window, if blank it will be a new GUID. This is helpful if you have multiple HTML windows open and need to distinguish them.

IncludeBootstrapJQuery.Name: IncludeBootstrapJQuery
IncludeBootstrapJQuery.Description: If true, includes Bootstrap 4 CSS/JS and jQuery 3.51 to the HTML document and inserts the HTML parameter value inside the <body> tag.

HTMLWindowExecuteScriptAsync.Name: HTMLWindowExecuteScriptAsync
HTMLWindowExecuteScriptAsync.Description: Executes JavaScript inside the specified HTML window.
HTMLWindowExecuteScriptAsync.FullExample:
// Assumes you are using the Example from HTMLWindow
	sp.HTMLWindowExecuteScriptAsync(sp.GetStoredHandle("testWindowHandle"), "alert('Hello!');");

InputBox.Name: InputBox
InputBox.Description: Displays a window which can be used to collect user input. See InputBoxInfo for more details.

info.Name: info
info.Description: The InputBoxInfo object containing the info used when displaying the input window.

MessageBox.Name: MessageBox
MessageBox.Description: Displays a simple message box with a title and message.

message.Name: message
message.Description: Title of the message box window.

title.Name: title
title.Description: Message of the message box window.

ShowBalloonTip.Name: ShowBalloonTip
ShowBalloonTip.Description: Displays a balloon tool window or a toast style notification popup depending on the version of Windows. NOTE: This functionality can be overridden or prevented based on Windows settings and rules that govern notifications.

icon.Name: icon
icon.Description: The icon to be used in the ballon/toast popup. Valid values: info, error, or warning.

timeout.Name: timeout
timeout.Description: How long to display the balloon/toast popup.

ShowPopupMenu.Name: ShowPopupMenu
ShowPopupMenu.Description: Displays a context menu from which the user can select an item. This requires a global javascript callback to receive the selected item. See PopupMenuInfo and the examples for more information.

info.Name: info
info.Description: The PopupMenuInfo object containing the info used when displaying the popup menu.

ShowPopupMenuEx.Name: ShowPopupMenuEx
ShowPopupMenuEx.Description: Displays a context menu from which the user can select an item. This is an extended version of ShowPopupMenu that allows for more a complex menu structure and doesn't require a callback.

info.Name: info
info.Description: The PopupMenuInfoEx object containing the info used when displaying the popup menu.

SectionOperatingSystem.Name: Operating System
SectionOperatingSystem.Description: Functions for working with the operating system.

ExpandEnvironmentVariables.Name: ExpandEnvironmentVariables
ExpandEnvironmentVariables.Description: Returns a string with the environment variables expanded.

stringToExpand.Name: stringToExpand
stringToExpand.Description: String containing the environment variables to be expanded.

GetActiveExplorerPath.Name: GetActiveExplorerPath
GetActiveExplorerPath.Description: Returns a string containing path of the specified Explorer window.

GetItemsInExplorer.Name: GetItemsInExplorer
GetItemsInExplorer.Description: Returns a array of strings containing each file selected in the specified Explorer window.
GetItemsInExplorer.SimpleExample: var items = sp.GetItemsInExplorer(action.Window.HWnd, false, true, false);

onlyNames.Name: onlyNames
onlyNames.Description: If true, only return names, not the full path and name.

includeLinks.Name: includeLinks
includeLinks.Description: If true, also include link items.

GetSelectedFilesInExplorer.Name: GetSelectedFilesInExplorer
GetSelectedFilesInExplorer.Description: Returns a array of strings containing each file selected in the specified Explorer window.

GetSelectedFilesOnDesktop.Name: GetSelectedFilesOnDesktop
GetSelectedFilesOnDesktop.Description: Returns a array of strings containing each file selected in the Desktop window list view.

GetSystemMetricsByIndex.Name: GetSystemMetricsByIndex
GetSystemMetricsByIndex.Description: Returns an int value of the specified SystemMetric.

Run.Name: Run
Run.Description: Opens a file or runs a program. This is the same as typing something in the Run dialog (Win+R) and pressing Enter. Use sp.RunProgram for more specific execution options.

command.Name: command
command.Description: The file name of the item to execute or open.

RunOrActivate.Name: RunOrActivate
RunOrActivate.Description: Takes a full path and EXE name and looks to see if there is a window already running for that EXE and activates it, otherwise it runs the EXE.

command.Name: command
command.Description: The full path and file name of the program to activate or open.

RunProgram.Name: RunProgram
RunProgram.Description: Opens a file or runs a program.

fileName.Name: fileName
fileName.Description: The file name of the item to execute or open.

arguments.Name: arguments
arguments.Description: Command line arguments to pass to the program.

verb.Name: verb
verb.Description: The ShellExecute verb to use, if applicable.

windowStyle.Name: windowStyle
windowStyle.Description: State of the window when started, valid values: hidden, normal, minimized, maximized.

useShellExecute.Name: useShellExecute
useShellExecute.Description: If true, uses the Windows shell to execute the program or open the file. False executes only a program directly.

noWindow.Name: noWindow
noWindow.Description: Specifies that no window should be created for the process.

waitForExit.Name: waitForExit
waitForExit.Description: If true, this method will wait until the program has exited, which returns the exit code from the program.

RunStoreApp.Name: RunStoreApp
RunStoreApp.Description: Takes a full or partial Store app package name and activates or runs it. If more than one match is found, the first match will be used. Note there is a slight delay due to enumerating all installed Store apps.
RunStoreApp.SimpleExample: sp.RunStoreApp('Microsoft.WindowsCalculator'); //Or just 'Calculator' if there are no other similarly named apps installed.

packageName.Name: packageName
packageName.Description: The full or partial package name of the Store app.

SectionMedia.Name: Media
SectionMedia.Description: Functions for working with the AudioSwitcher media objects.

GetCaptureMixer.Name: GetCaptureMixer
GetCaptureMixer.Description: Returns a AudioSwitcher.AudioApi.CoreAudio.CoreAudioDevice object which allows controlling the default capture (record) mixer/device.

GetCommunicationsCaptureMixer.Name: GetCommunicationsCaptureMixer
GetCommunicationsCaptureMixer.Description: Returns a AudioSwitcher.AudioApi.CoreAudio.CoreAudioDevice object which allows controlling the default communications capture (record) mixer/device.

GetCommunicationsMixer.Name: GetCommunicationsMixer
GetCommunicationsMixer.Description: Returns a AudioSwitcher.AudioApi.CoreAudio.CoreAudioDevice object which allows controlling the default communications mixer/device.

GetCommunicationsVolume.Name: GetCommunicationsVolume
GetCommunicationsVolume.Description: Returns the current volume level of the default communications mixer/device. (0 - 100)

GetPlaybackMixer.Name: GetPlaybackMixer
GetPlaybackMixer.Description: Returns a AudioSwitcher.AudioApi.CoreAudio.CoreAudioDevice object which allows controlling the default playback mixer/device.

GetPlaybackVolume.Name: GetPlaybackVolume
GetPlaybackVolume.Description: Returns the current volume level of the default playback mixer/device. (0 - 100)

PlaySound.Name: PlaySound
PlaySound.Description: Plays a .wav file. Does not support other sound formats.

filePath.Name: filePath
filePath.Description: The full file path of the .wav file to play.

SetCommunicationsVolume.Name: SetCommunicationsVolume
SetCommunicationsVolume.Description: Sets the volume level of the default communications mixer/device. (0 - 100)

SetPlaybackVolume.Name: SetPlaybackVolume
SetPlaybackVolume.Description: Sets the volume level of the default playback mixer/device. (0 - 100)

ToggleCommunicationsMute.Name: ToggleCommunicationsMute
ToggleCommunicationsMute.Description: Toggles mute on the default communications mixer/device.

TogglePlaybackMute.Name: TogglePlaybackMute
TogglePlaybackMute.Description: Toggles mute on the default playback mixer/device.

GetCurrentMouseCursor.Name: GetCurrentMouseCursor
GetCurrentMouseCursor.Description: Returns the name of the current mouse cursor. NOTE: This will only compare against the standard Windows cursors as defined by the Microsoft 'Cursors Class' properties, e.g. 'AppStarting', 'Arrow', 'Hand', etc. Any custom cursors will not be recognized and the return value will be 'Unknown'.

GetCurrentMousePoint.Name: GetCurrentMousePoint
GetCurrentMousePoint.Description: Returns a point containing the coordinates of the current mouse position.

HideMouseCursor.Name: HideMouseCursor
HideMouseCursor.Description: Hides the mouse cursor. NOTE: This basically makes all cursors transparent and are restored via sp.ShowMouseCursor(). However, this simply resets the mouse cursors to the default icon set, so any custom cursors you have selected will be reverted.

MouseClick.Name: MouseClick
MouseClick.Description: Simulates pressing and/or releasing a mouse button at a specific location.

pt.Name: pt
pt.Description: The location to perform the mouse event(s). Can be an existing point like 'action.Start' or a custom one using 'new Point(x, y).

btn.Name: btn
btn.Description: The mouse button to use for the event(s).

down.Name: down
down.Description: Simulate pressing the specified mouse button down. Pass down and up as true to simulate a full click.

up.Name: up
up.Description: Simulate releasing the specified mouse button. Pass down and up as true to simulate a full click.

MouseMove.Name: MouseMove
MouseMove.Description: Moves the mouse to the specified location.

point.Name: point
point.Description: The location to move the mouse cursor to. Can be an existing point like 'action.Start' or a custom one using 'new Point(x, y).

MouseRestrictActive.Name: MouseRestrictActive
MouseRestrictActive.Description: Returns true or false, indicating whether the mouse is being restricted via sp.MouseRestrictToRectangle.

MouseRestrictClear.Name: MouseRestrictClear
MouseRestrictClear.Description: Removes the mouse movement restriction previously set via sp.MouseRestrictToRectangle.

MouseRestrictToRectangle.Name: MouseRestrictToRectangle
MouseRestrictToRectangle.Description: Restricts mouse movement to only within the specified rectangle.

rectangle.Name: rectangle
rectangle.Description: The rectangle (screen coordinates) inside which the mouse cannot leave.

MouseWheel.Name: MouseWheel
MouseWheel.Description: Simulates scrolling the mouse wheel vertically (default) or horizontally.

point.Name: point
point.Description: The location to perform the mouse event(s). Can be an existing point like 'action.Start' or a custom one using 'new Point(x, y).

horizontal.Name: horizontal
horizontal.Description: If true, the wheel event is sent as a horizontal scroll, otherwise vertical is used.

delta.Name: delta
delta.Description: The positive or negative delta (change) to send indicating how far the wheel was scrolled. The standard is in increments of 120 and is recommended, e.g. 120 or -120.

SetMouseCursor.Name: SetMouseCursor
SetMouseCursor.Description: Sets the specified system cursor to the cursor loaded from the specified file. This cursor is not saved, reloading Windows or calling sp.ShowMouseCursor() will revert to cursor defined in Control Panel.

cursorType.Name: cursorType
cursorType.Description: One of the following values: Arrow, IBeam, WaitCursor, Cross, UpArrow, SizeNWSE, SizeNESW, SizeWE, SizeNS, SizeAll, No, Hand, AppStarting, Help

fileName.Name: fileName
fileName.Description: The cursor file to load. File must be .CUR or .ANI file type.

ShowMouseCursor.Name: ShowMouseCursor
ShowMouseCursor.Description: Shows the mouse cursor after a call to sp.HideMouseCursor. NOTE: This simply resets all cursors to the Windows default, overwriting any custom cursor selections.

GetFileProductVersionInfo.Name: GetFileProductVersionInfo
GetFileProductVersionInfo.Description: Returns a string represnting the file's product version, as returned by FileVersionInfo.ProductVersion.

filePath.Name: filePath
filePath.Description: The full path and name to the file.

GetFileVersionInfo.Name: GetFileVersionInfo
GetFileVersionInfo.Description: Returns a string representing the file's version number, in the format of x.x.x.x

filePath.Name: filePath
filePath.Description: The full path and name to the file.

GetKeyState.Name: GetKeyState
GetKeyState.Description: Returns a short (number) containing the key state data for the specified key. See the GetKeyState Microsoft documentation for key state data details.

vk.Name: vk
vk.Description: The VirtualKeyCode (vk.XX) value to get the state for.

IsKeyToggled.Name: IsKeyToggled
IsKeyToggled.Description: Returns true if the specified key is toggled on. This is intended for the Caps, Num, and Scroll lock keys.

SendAltDown.Name: SendAltDown
SendAltDown.Description: Simulates pressing the left Alt key down.

SendAltUp.Name: SendAltUp
SendAltUp.Description: Simulates releasing the left Alt key.

SendCharacter.Name: SendCharacter
SendCharacter.Description: Simulates pressing and releasing the specified character.

ch.Name: ch
ch.Description: Value of the character to send.

SendControlDown.Name: SendControlDown
SendControlDown.Description: Simulates pressing the left Control key down.

SendControlUp.Name: SendControlUp
SendControlUp.Description: Simulates releasing the left Control key.

SendKeyDown.Name: SendKeyDown
SendKeyDown.Description: Simulates pressing the specified character key down.

ch.Name: ch
ch.Description: Value of the character to send.

SendKeys.Name: SendKeys
SendKeys.Description: Simulates sending a sequence of keystrokes using the Microsoft SendKeys.SendWait() method. Search the internet for 'SendKeys Class' to find specific rules and keywords when using this action.

sendKeysString.Name: sendKeysString
sendKeysString.Description: The SendKeys compatible sequence of keystrokes to send.

SendModifiedVKeys.Name: SendModifiedVKeys
SendModifiedVKeys.Description: Simulates pressing a key combination, like Ctrl+S, Win+E, etc. The modifiers are held down, the keys are sent, then the modifiers are released.

Modifiers.Name: Modifiers
Modifiers.Description: Single (vk.XX) or array ([vk.XX, vk.XX]) of VirtualKeyCode modifier value(s). Modifiers are Control, Alt, Shift, and Win keys.

Keys.Name: Keys
Keys.Description: Single (vk.XX) or array ([vk.XX, vk.XX]) of VirtualKeyCode values to send after the modifiers have been pressed down.

SendShiftDown.Name: SendShiftDown
SendShiftDown.Description: Simulates pressing the left Shift key down.

SendShiftUp.Name: SendShiftUp
SendShiftUp.Description: Simulates releasing the left Shift key.

SendString.Name: SendString
SendString.Description: Simulates sending a sequence of characters.

SendUnicodeString.Name: SendUnicodeString
SendUnicodeString.Description: Simulates sending a sequence of Unicode characters. Not sure if this function is required, I wanted to provide multiple methods for international users.

SendVKey.Name: SendVKey
SendVKey.Description: Simulates pressing and releasing the specified VirtualKeyCode.

SendVKeyDown.Name: SendVKeyDown
SendVKeyDown.Description: Simulates pressing the specified virtual key down.

virtualKey.Name: virtualKey
virtualKey.Description: Value of the virtual key to send (vk.XX).

SendWinDown.Name: SendWinDown
SendWinDown.Description: Simulates pressing the left Win key down.

SendWinUp.Name: SendWinUp
SendWinUp.Description: Simulates releasing the left Win key.

SectionMacros.Name: Macros
SectionMacros.Description: Functions for working with stored macros and recording/playing temporary ones.

GetMacroScript.Name: GetMacroScript
GetMacroScript.Description: Returns the full script for the specified macro.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Name of the category to whih the macro belongs.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the macro.

GetTemporaryMacroScript.Name: GetTemporaryMacroScript
GetTemporaryMacroScript.Description: Returns the script of the last temporary macro.

PlayTemporaryMacro.Name: PlayTemporaryMacro
PlayTemporaryMacro.Description: Plays the last temporary macro. If you use this in a hotkey, you should add a sp.Sleep(1000); before calling this function to ensure you release the hotkeys before the macro starts or the keys could be stuck in the down state, or send the key up events for the keys used in the hotkey as shown in the full example.
PlayTemporaryMacro.SimpleExample:
//IMPORTANT: If calling this from a hotkey, make sure to add a sp.Sleep(1000); before calling this function to ensure you release the hotkeys before the macro starts or the keys could be stuck in the down state, or send the key up events for the keys used in the hotkey as shown in the full example.
sp.PlayTemporaryMacro();

RecordTemporaryMacro.Name: RecordTemporaryMacro
RecordTemporaryMacro.Description: Starts recording a temporary macro. No messages show, you must remember to press Ctrl+Break (Pause) to stop recording.
RecordTemporaryMacro.SimpleExample:
//Note: If calling this from a hotkey, you should add a sp.Sleep(1000); before the calling this function, to ensure when you release the hotkey that those aren't recorded.
sp.RecordTemporaryMacro();

GetMethod.Name: GetMethod
GetMethod.Description: Returns a MethodInfo object for the specified function.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the sp.(Function), e.g. 'GetMethod'.

GetMethods.Name: GetMethods
GetMethods.Description: Returns an array of MethodInfo for all sp functions.

GetPixelColorFromPoint.Name: GetPixelColorFromPoint
GetPixelColorFromPoint.Description: Returns a Color struct for the pixel at the location of the point passed in.

point.Name: point
point.Description: Location on the screen to find the pixel's color.

GetPoint.Name: GetPoint
GetPoint.Description: (deprecated) Returns a point based on the the x and y coordinates passed in. Use 'new Point(x,y)' instead.

Pause.Name: Pause
Pause.Description: Wait for the specified seconds before continuing execution. Use sp.Sleep for short or precise delays.

seconds.Name: seconds
seconds.Description: The duration in seconds to wait.

Sleep.Name: Sleep
Sleep.Description: Wait for the specified millseconds before continuing execution. This is a high resolution timer which should only be used for short pauses.

milliseconds.Name: milliseconds
milliseconds.Description: The duration in milliseconds to wait.

SectionRegions.Name: Regions
SectionRegions.Description: Functions for working with StrokesPlus.net regions.

GetRegionFromPoint.Name: GetRegionFromPoint
GetRegionFromPoint.Description: Returns a RectRegion based on the location of the point within the rectangle passed in, which is divided into regions based on the number of columns and rows specified. This could be used to have a action perform different logic based on the location of a point within the area of the screen or application window, for example.

rect.Name: rect
rect.Description: The rectangle representing the area which will be divided into regions and returned.

point.Name: point
point.Description: The point to use when determining the region in which the point exists within the rectangle.

columns.Name: columns
columns.Description: The number of columns to divide the rectangle into.

rows.Name: rows
rows.Description: The number of row to divide the rectangle into.

GetRegions.Name: GetRegions
GetRegions.Description: Returns an array of RectRegion based on the rectangle passed in along with the number of columns and rows specified. This could be used to have a action perform different logic based on the area of the screen or application window, for example.

rect.Name: rect
rect.Description: The rectangle representing the area which will be divided into regions and returned.

columns.Name: columns
columns.Description: The number of columns to divide the rectangle into.

rows.Name: rows
rows.Description: The number of row to divide the rectangle into.

SectionNativeDynamic.Name: Native and Dynamic
SectionNativeDynamic.Description:
These methods allow you to build dynamic modules, types, and methods via System.Reflection, as well as create delegate pointers for callbacks to script functions.

See the Extensions category for additional related extension methods relating to these methods.
	
See this post for more details: https://forum.strokesplus.net/posts/m11783-Example---Test-Code-for-Native-Binding

NativeDelegate.Name: NativeDelegate
NativeDelegate.Description: Compiles a custom static C# class to host the delegate for a native API callback pointer.

functionName.Name: functionName
functionName.Description: Name of the JavaScript function for which this delegate will reference and invoke.

parameterTypes.Name: parameterTypes
parameterTypes.Description: Array of .NET types to indicate the type of the parameters for the callback (in order).

returnType.Name: returnType
returnType.Description: (optional) The .NET type which the function returns, null for void.

NativeDelegateList.Name: NativeDelegateList
NativeDelegateList.Description: Creates a custom class for multiple function delegates at the same time.

delegateList.Name: delegateList
delegateList.Description: Array of parameters which match the NativeDelegate function. For example: [["EnumWindowsProc", [IntPtrT, IntPtrT], BooleanT],["EnumWindowsProcA", [IntPtrT, IntPtrT], BooleanT]]

NativeModule.Name: NativeModule
NativeModule.Description: Retrieves (or creates) a native module as a ModuleBuilder. Default is the module if no name is provided. This ModuleBuilder lets you create custom types, methods, PInvokes, enums via System.Reflection.Emit.
NativeModule.SimpleExample:
var defaultModBuilder = sp.NativeModule();
var apiModBuilder = sp.NativeModule("WinAPI");

moduleName.Name: moduleName
moduleName.Description: Name of the module (or leave blank for Default).

RefreshNativeModules.Name: RefreshNativeModules
RefreshNativeModules.Description: Refreshes the dynamic native modules and delegates within the script engine type list. These would be any types or objects within NativeModules. or NativeDelegates.

SectionRegistry.Name: Registry
SectionRegistry.Description: Functions for working with the Windows Registry.

baseKey.Name: baseKey
baseKey.Description: RegistryKey representing the registry key where the keyName exists.

subKey.Name: subKey
subKey.Description: Name of the subkey within the baseKey to delete.

keyName.Name: keyName
keyName.Description: The key to delete from the keyName.

showErrors.Name: showErrors
showErrors.Description: Displays an error message box, if the action was not successful.

baseKey.Name: baseKey
baseKey.Description: RegistryKey representing the registry key where the keyName exists.

subKey.Name: subKey
subKey.Description: Name of the subkey within the baseKey to delete.

showErrors.Name: showErrors
showErrors.Description: Displays an error message box, if the action was not successful.

RegistryReadMultiString.Name: RegistryReadMultiString
RegistryReadMultiString.Description: Reads the specified registry key and return an array of strings.

baseKey.Name: baseKey
baseKey.Description: RegistryKey representing the registry key where the keyName exists.

subKey.Name: subKey
subKey.Description: Name of the subkey within the baseKey to read the value from.

keyName.Name: keyName
keyName.Description: Name of the key within the subkey to read the value from.

showErrors.Name: showErrors
showErrors.Description: Displays an error message box, if the action was not successful.

RegistryReadNumber.Name: RegistryReadNumber
RegistryReadNumber.Description: Reads the specified registry key and return the number.

baseKey.Name: baseKey
baseKey.Description: RegistryKey representing the registry key where the keyName exists.

subKey.Name: subKey
subKey.Description: Name of the subkey within the baseKey to read the value from.

keyName.Name: keyName
keyName.Description: Name of the key within the subkey to read the value from.

showErrors.Name: showErrors
showErrors.Description: Displays an error message box, if the action was not successful.

RegistryReadString.Name: RegistryReadString
RegistryReadString.Description: Reads the specified registry key and return the string.

baseKey.Name: baseKey
baseKey.Description: RegistryKey representing the registry key where the keyName exists.

subKey.Name: subKey
subKey.Description: Name of the subkey within the baseKey to read the value from.

keyName.Name: keyName
keyName.Description: Name of the key within the subkey to read the value from.

showErrors.Name: showErrors
showErrors.Description: Displays an error message box, if the action was not successful.

RegistryWrite.Name: RegistryWrite
RegistryWrite.Description: Writes a key/value to the registry.

baseKey.Name: baseKey
baseKey.Description: RegistryKey representing the registry key where the keyName exists.

keyName.Name: keyName
keyName.Description: Name of the subkey within the baseKey to store the value in.

keyValue.Name: keyValue
keyValue.Description: The name of the key to write.

kind.Name: kind
kind.Description: The type of value to store, valid options: binary, dword, expandstring, multistring, none, qword, string, unknown.

showErrors.Name: showErrors
showErrors.Description: Displays an error message box, if the action was not successful.

TouchFloaterCloseCustomFloater.Name: TouchFloaterCloseCustomFloater
TouchFloaterCloseCustomFloater.Description: Close a custom floater by name. Only works if floaters are currently shown.

floaterName.Name: floaterName
floaterName.Description: Name of the custom floater to close.

TouchFloaterIsCustomFloaterLoaded.Name: TouchFloaterIsCustomFloaterLoaded
TouchFloaterIsCustomFloaterLoaded.Description: Returns true if the floater matching the name is currently loaded.

TouchFloaterIsShown.Name: TouchFloaterIsShown
TouchFloaterIsShown.Description: Returns true if the main floater is shown.

TouchFloaterLoadCustomFloater.Name: TouchFloaterLoadCustomFloater
TouchFloaterLoadCustomFloater.Description: Load a custom floater by name. Only works if floaters are currently shown.

floaterName.Name: floaterName
floaterName.Description: Name of the custom floater to load.

TouchFloaterLoadLayout.Name: TouchFloaterLoadLayout
TouchFloaterLoadLayout.Description: Load a floater layout by name. Only works if floaters are currently shown.

layoutName.Name: layoutName
layoutName.Description: Name of the floater layout to load.

TouchFloaterSetCustomFloaterLocation.Name: TouchFloaterSetCustomFloaterLocation
TouchFloaterSetCustomFloaterLocation.Description: Move a custom floater to a new location. Only works if floaters are currently shown.

floaterName.Name: floaterName
floaterName.Description: Name of the custom floater to move.

TouchFloaterSetLocation.Name: TouchFloaterSetLocation
TouchFloaterSetLocation.Description: Move a custom floater to a new location. Only works if floaters are currently shown.

TouchFloatersReset.Name: TouchFloatersReset
TouchFloatersReset.Description: Resets the main floaters to their default positions.

TouchFloaterToggle.Name: TouchFloaterToggle
TouchFloaterToggle.Description: Toggles the visibility of the floaters.

TouchFloaterToggleOthers.Name: TouchFloaterToggleOthers
TouchFloaterToggleOthers.Description: Toggles the visibility of the non-primary floaters.

SectionExtensions.Name: Extensions
SectionExtensions.Description: These are extensions to existing .NET types which are specific to StrokesPlus.net.

ModuleBuilder.CreateType.Name: ModuleBuilder.CreateType
ModuleBuilder.CreateType.Description: Alias for ModuleBuilder.DefineType to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder object. This creates a finalized type, so it cannot be altered, only added to via nested elements.

typeName.Name: typeName
typeName.Description: The name of the type to create.

typeAttributes.Name: typeAttributes
typeAttributes.Description: Comma-separated list of TypeAttributes to apply to the type.

ModuleBuilder.DefineEnum.Name: ModuleBuilder.DefineEnum
ModuleBuilder.DefineEnum.Description: Overload for ModuleBuilder.DefineEnum to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.EnumBuilder object.

enumName.Name: enumName
enumName.Description: The name of the enum to create.

names.Name: names
names.Description: Comma-separated list of names for the enum fields.

values.Name: values
values.Description: Array of values for each field (same order and count).
values.Type: int[] (or valid underlyingType of: byte, sbyte, short, ushort, int, uint, long, and ulong

typeAttributes.Name: typeAttributes
typeAttributes.Description: (optional) Comma-separated list of TypeAtrtribute for the enum.

underlyingType.Name: underlyingType
underlyingType.Description: (optional) Valid enum type of: byte, sbyte, short, ushort, int, uint, long, and ulong

ModuleBuilder.DefineType.Name: ModuleBuilder.DefineType
ModuleBuilder.DefineType.Description: Overload for ModuleBuilder.DefineType to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder object. This defines the type, but does not create it, so the type can still be defined further.

typeName.Name: typeName
typeName.Description: The name of the type to create.

typeAttributes.Name: typeAttributes
typeAttributes.Description: Comma-separated list of TypeAttributes to apply to the type.

TypeBuilder.Create.Name: TypeBuilder.Create
TypeBuilder.Create.Description: Calls TypeBuilder.CreateType() and refreshes the script engine types.

TypeBuilder.DefineNestedEnum.Name: TypeBuilder.DefineNestedEnum
TypeBuilder.DefineNestedEnum.Description: Alias for TypeBuilder.DefineNestedType to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder object.

enumName.Name: enumName
enumName.Description: The name of the enum to create.

names.Name: names
names.Description: Comma-separated list of names for the enum fields.

values.Name: values
values.Description: Array of values for each field (same order and count).
values.Type: int[] (or valid underlyingType of: byte, sbyte, short, ushort, int, uint, long, and ulong

typeAttributes.Name: typeAttributes
typeAttributes.Description: (optional) Comma-separated list of TypeAtrtribute for the enum.

underlyingType.Name: underlyingType
underlyingType.Description: (optional) Valid enum type of: byte, sbyte, short, ushort, int, uint, long, and ulong

TypeBuilder.DefineNestedStruct.Name: TypeBuilder.DefineNestedStruct
TypeBuilder.DefineNestedStruct.Description: Alias for TypeBuilder.DefineNestedType to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder object.

structName.Name: structName
structName.Description: Name of the struct to create.

fieldNames.Name: fieldNames
fieldNames.Description: Comma-separated list of field names for this struct.

fieldTypes.Name: fieldTypes
fieldTypes.Description: Array of .NET types for each of the field names (same order and count).

fieldMarshalAs.Name: fieldMarshalAs
fieldMarshalAs.Description: (optional) Array of System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType for each of of the field names (same order and count).

fieldMarshalArg.Name: fieldMarshalArg
fieldMarshalArg.Description: (optional) Only used for UnmanagedType.ByValArray fields to set the SizeConst value, but array length must have same count as fieldMarshalAs, use 0 for irrelevant fields.

structLayout.Name: structLayout
structLayout.Description: (optional) Custom string array to combine TypeAttribute and StructLayoutAttribute values (either set can be omitted). Example: ['Explicit,Unicode','Size=8,Pack=4']

fieldOffsets.Name: fieldOffsets
fieldOffsets.Description: (optional) Comma-separated list of System.Reflection.FieldAttribute for each of of the field names (same order and count).

fieldAttributes.Name: fieldAttributes
fieldAttributes.Description: (optional) Comma-separated list of System.Reflection.FieldAttribute for each of of the field names (same order and count).

TypeBuilder.DefinePInvokeMethod.Name: TypeBuilder.DefinePInvokeMethod
TypeBuilder.DefinePInvokeMethod.Description: Overload for TypeBuilder.DefinePInvokeMethod to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.MethodBuilder object.

entryName.Name: entryName
entryName.Description: Name of the entry in the specified DLL.

dllName.Name: dllName
dllName.Description: Path and name of DLL where entryName exists.

parameterTypes.Name: parameterTypes
parameterTypes.Description: Array or .NET types which represent the type and order of the entry parameters.

returnType.Name: returnType
returnType.Description: (optional) Type of value returned by the DLL method.

methodName.Name: methodName
methodName.Description: (optional) Name for the method as it will be exposed by the type (defaults to entryName).

dllImportAttributes.Name: dllImportAttributes
dllImportAttributes.Description: (optional) Comma-separated list of name=value for DllImport attribute properties. e.g. 'SetLastError=true,CharSet=Unicode,'

callingConvention.Name: callingConvention
callingConvention.Description: (optional) Comma-separaed list of System.Reflection.CallingConventions to pass to DefinePInvokeMethod when creating the method.

nativeCallingConvention.Name: nativeCallingConvention
nativeCallingConvention.Description: (optional) System.Runtime.InteropServices.CallingConvention to pass to DefinePInvokeMethod when creating the method.

nativeCharSet.Name: nativeCharSet
nativeCharSet.Description: (optional) System.Runtime.InteropServices.CharSet to pass to DefinePInvokeMethod when creating the method.

TypeBuilder.NewMethod.Name: TypeBuilder.NewMethod
TypeBuilder.NewMethod.Description: Alias for TypeBuilder.DefineMethod to simplify obtaining an instantiated System.Reflection.Emit.MethodBuilder object.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Name of the method to define.

parameterTypes.Name: parameterTypes
parameterTypes.Description: Array of .NET Types for the method parameters (in order)

returnType.Name: returnType
returnType.Description: (optional) .NET type for the method, null for void

MethodBuilder.AddMethodImplAttributes.Name: MethodBuilder.AddMethodImplAttributes
MethodBuilder.AddMethodImplAttributes.Description: Adds a MethodImplAttributes flag to the current value.

EnumBuilder.Create.Name: EnumBuilder.Create
EnumBuilder.Create.Description: Calls EnumBuilder.CreateType() and refreshes the script engine types.

IEnumerable.Distinct.Name: IEnumerable.Distinct
IEnumerable.Distinct.Description: Accepts a property name to select distinct and return a new List<T>.

element.Name: element
element.Description: Name of the property to perform the distinct operation against.

IEnumerable.forEach.Name: IEnumerable.forEach
IEnumerable.forEach.Description: Provides a method of iterating over the elements of an IEnumerable and performing an action.

action.Name: action
action.Description: Action (function) to perform on each item.

IEnumerable.OrderBy.Name: IEnumerable.OrderBy
IEnumerable.OrderBy.Description: Sorts an IEnumerable by a single property name and flag for descending.
IEnumerable.OrderBy.SimpleExample:
var mySortedList = myList.OrderBy("PropertyName");
var myDescSortedList = myList.OrderBy("PropertyName desc");

sortExpression.Name: sortExpression
sortExpression.Description: Specifies the property name to sort by, and an optional space followed by "desc" to signal descending sort order.

IEnumerable.OrderByMultiple.Name: IEnumerable.OrderByMultiple
IEnumerable.OrderByMultiple.Description: Sorts an IEnumerable based on the string passed in.

queryString.Name: queryString
queryString.Description: Custom format string used to parse out the sorting operations. Property|Sort where Sort 0 = ascending and Sort 1 = descending. For example: "Category|0,Description|1". - sort by Category ASC first, then by Description DESC.

IEnumerable.Where.Name: IEnumerable.Where
IEnumerable.Where.Description: Applies a boolean predicate against the IEnumerable and returns an IEnumerable<T>.

SectionSystemWindow.Name: SystemWindow

Activate.Name: Activate
Activate.Description: Restores, shows, and brings the window to the foreground.

AllScreens.Name: AllScreens
AllScreens.Description: Returns an array of Screen objects containing all screens as defined by Windows.

BringToFront.Name: BringToFront
BringToFront.Description: Sets the window as the foregroup window.

Center.Name: Center
Center.Description: Centers the window on the screen where the window resides.

ClientPointToScreenPoint.Name: ClientPointToScreenPoint
ClientPointToScreenPoint.Description: Returns a Point translated from client coordinates to screen coordinates relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.

clientPoint.Name: clientPoint
clientPoint.Description: The client Point to translate to a screen point.

ClipToScreen.Name: ClipToScreen
ClipToScreen.Description: Clips the window to the screen where the window resides.

EnsureVisible.Name: EnsureVisible
EnsureVisible.Description: Moves the window to ensure it's displayed as fully as it can be on the current or closest screen.

FitToScreen.Name: FitToScreen
FitToScreen.Description: Fits the window on the screen where the window resides.

Highlight.Name: Highlight
Highlight.Description: Highlights the window with a red border. Not very consistent or reliable.

IsDescendantOf.Name: IsDescendantOf
IsDescendantOf.Description: Returns true if this object is a child of the ancestor object.

ancestor.Name: ancestor
ancestor.Description: The SystemWindow object to search through children.

MoveToNextScreen.Name: MoveToNextScreen
MoveToNextScreen.Description: Moves the window to the next screen as defined in Windows, returns the new Screen.

MoveToPreviousScreen.Name: MoveToPreviousScreen
MoveToPreviousScreen.Description: Moves the window to the previous screen as defined in Windows, returns the new Screen.

MoveToScreen.Name: MoveToScreen
MoveToScreen.Description: Moves the window to the specified screen number (index) as defined in Windows or Screen object, returns the new Screen.

number or screen.Name: number or screen
number or screen.Description: The index of the screen to send the window to or a Screen object. See AllScreens to get all screen which can be used to determine the screen indexes.
number or screen.Type: object (Screen object or casts to int)

PostMessageObj.Name: PostMessageObj
PostMessageObj.Description: Posts a message to the control or window.

message.Name: message
message.Description: The message value to post, casted to uint.

wParam.Name: wParam
wParam.Description: The wParam value to post, casted to IntPtr.

lParam.Name: lParam
lParam.Description: The lParam value to post, casted to IntPtr.

Refresh.Name: Refresh
Refresh.Description: If supported, invalidates the client area of the window and forces a redraw.

ScreenFromPoint.Name: ScreenFromPoint
ScreenFromPoint.Description: Returns a screen based on a location.

pt.Name: pt
pt.Description: The screen coordinates to use for locating the screen.

ScreenPointToClientPoint.Name: ScreenPointToClientPoint
ScreenPointToClientPoint.Description: Returns a Point translated from screen coordinates to client coordinates relative to the upper-left corner of the window's client area.

screenPoint.Name: screenPoint
screenPoint.Description: The screen Point to translate to a client point.

SendClose.Name: SendClose
SendClose.Description: Sends the WM_CLOSE message to the window.

SendMessageGetTextObj.Name: SendMessageGetTextObj
SendMessageGetTextObj.Description: Sends a get text message to the control or window and returns a string containing the text.

message.Name: message
message.Description: The message value to post, casted to uint.

length.Name: length
length.Description: The length of text to retrieve, casted to int.

SendMessageObj.Name: SendMessageObj
SendMessageObj.Description: Sends a message to the control or window.

message.Name: message
message.Description: The message value to post, casted to uint.

wParam.Name: wParam
wParam.Description: The wParam value to post, casted to IntPtr.

lParam.Name: lParam
lParam.Description: The lParam value to post, casted to IntPtr.

SendMessageSetTextObj.Name: SendMessageSetTextObj
SendMessageSetTextObj.Description: Sends a set text message to the control or window.

message.Name: message
message.Description: The message value to post, casted to uint.

wParam.Name: wParam
wParam.Description: The wParam value to post, casted to IntPtr.

lParam.Name: lParam
lParam.Description: The lParam value to post, casted to IntPtr.

useAnsi.Name: useAnsi
useAnsi.Description: Pass true to specificy ANSI mode, false for Unicode.

SendToBottom.Name: SendToBottom
SendToBottom.Description: Sends the window to the bottom of the window stack/z-index.

SupportsSelection.Name: SupportsSelection
SupportsSelection.Description: Returns true if the control supports selections via messaging (DLGC_HASSETSEL)

AbsoluteRectangle.Name: AbsoluteRectangle
AbsoluteRectangle.Description: Returns a Rectangle object for the window frame, including window borders.

AllChildWindows.Name: AllChildWindows
AllChildWindows.Description: Returns as array of SystemWindow objects for direct child controls or window.

AllDescendantWindows.Name: AllDescendantWindows
AllDescendantWindows.Description: Returns as array of SystemWindow objects for all descendant controls or window.

Alpha.Name: Alpha
Alpha.Description: Gets or sets the transparency of the window (0 - 255 where 0 is invisible).

CheckState.Name: CheckState
CheckState.Description: Whether this control, which is a check box or radio button, is checked.

ClassName.Name: ClassName
ClassName.Description: Gets the class name of the control or window.

ClientRectangle.Name: ClientRectangle
ClientRectangle.Description: Returns a Rectangle object for the client position of the control or window on the screen. ClientRectangle always starts with the top left of 0,0.

ColorKey.Name: ColorKey
ColorKey.Description: Gets or sets the color key (transparent color) of the window, use Color.Transparent to remove the color key. Some applications behave erratically and cannot be clicked.
ColorKey.SimpleExample:
.ColorKey = Color.White; //See Color struct docs for known colors
.ColorKey = Color.FromArgb(255, 255, 255); //RGB
.ColorKey = Color.Transparent; //Remove color key

CommandLine.Name: CommandLine
CommandLine.Description: Gets the command line for the process via WMI.

DialogID.Name: DialogID
DialogID.Description: Returns the dialog ID for the control or window.

Enabled.Name: Enabled
Enabled.Description: Gets or sets the enabled state of the control or window.

FirstMoveableParent.Name: FirstMoveableParent
FirstMoveableParent.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for first parent window which is moveable; a window which has a system menu. If the window itself is moveable, it returns itself. If no matching parent is found, returns null.

GetRootOwnerWindow.Name: GetRootOwnerWindow
GetRootOwnerWindow.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the root owner control or window.

HWnd.Name: HWnd
HWnd.Description: Returns the handle to the control or window.

Image.Name: Image
Image.Description: Returns an image object of the window, similar to Alt+Print Screen.

IsCloaked.Name: IsCloaked
IsCloaked.Description: Returns true if the window is cloaked, such as background Win8/10 apps or windows in a different virtual desktop.

IsImmersive.Name: IsImmersive
IsImmersive.Description: Returns true if the window is flagged as immersive, which is generally a Windows 8 Metro/Store type app.

IsUnicode.Name: IsUnicode
IsUnicode.Description: Returns true if the windows is flagged as Unicode.

LegacyModuleName.Name: LegacyModuleName
LegacyModuleName.Description: Returns the module name for this control or window's process using a direct WinAPI call.

Location.Name: Location
Location.Description: The location of the control or window inside its parent or on the screen, does not include window borders.

Maximized.Name: Maximized
Maximized.Description: Returns true if the window is maximized.

Minimized.Name: Minimized
Minimized.Description: Returns true if the window in minimized.

Movable.Name: Movable
Movable.Description: Returns true if the window has the WS_SYSMENU flag.

Parent.Name: Parent
Parent.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the parent control or window.

ParentSymmetric.Name: ParentSymmetric
ParentSymmetric.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the parent control or window, but only if the control or window is a descendant of the .Parent.

Position.Name: Position
Position.Description: Returns a RECT object for the control or window position inside its parent or in workspace coordinates. Use Rectangle for absolute coordinates without borders, and AbsoluteRectangle for full rectangle.

Process.Name: Process
Process.Description: Returns the Process object for the control or window.

RealParent.Name: RealParent
RealParent.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the parent control or window, using a different set of rules to determine parent.

RECT.Name: RECT
RECT.Description: Returns a RECT object for the absolute position of the control or window on the screen, does not include window frame borders. Probably more convenient to use .Rectangle instead. Use .Position for relative location of controls.

Rectangle.Name: Rectangle
Rectangle.Description: Returns a Rectangle object for the position of the control or window on the screen, does not include window frame borders. Use .Position for relative location of controls and AbsoluteRectangle for full rectangle.

RectangleF.Name: RectangleF
RectangleF.Description: Returns a RectangleF (float) object for the position of the control or window on the screen, does not include window frame borders.

Region.Name: Region
Region.Description: Gets (if defined) or sets the region of the control or window.

Resizable.Name: Resizable
Resizable.Description: Returns true if the window has the WS_THICKFRAME flag.

RootWindow.Name: RootWindow
RootWindow.Description: Returns a SystemWindow object for the root control or window.

Screen.Name: Screen
Screen.Description: Gets the Screen object for the screen where the window currently resides.

Size.Name: Size
Size.Description: The size of the control or window, excluding window borders.

Text.Name: Text
Text.Description: Gets or sets the text of the control, if supported.

Thread.Name: Thread
Thread.Description: Returns the ProcessThread object for the control or window.

Title.Name: Title
Title.Description: Gets or sets the title/text of the control or window.

TopMost.Name: TopMost
TopMost.Description: Gets or sets the top most status of the control or window.

VisibilityFlag.Name: VisibilityFlag
VisibilityFlag.Description: Gets or sets the visibility status of the control or window.

Visible.Name: Visible
Visible.Description: Gets the visible status of the control or window.

WindowAbove.Name: WindowAbove
WindowAbove.Description: Gets the SystemWindow object for the window above.

WindowBelow.Name: WindowBelow
WindowBelow.Description: Gets the SystemWindow object for the window below.

WindowState.Name: WindowState
WindowState.Description: Returns the window state of the window.
